properties.areaDesc: Chattooga; Catoosa; Murray; Whitfield; Dade; Gordon; Floyd; Walker
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 12:32AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
At 1232 AM EST...a strong thunderstorm was over Rising Fawn, or 9
miles south of Trenton...moving east at 50 mph.

HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind...frequent cloud to ground lightning
and heavy rain.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light...unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.

Some locations in the path of this storm include
Dalton, Calhoun, Lafayette, Summerville, Ringgold, Trenton, Fort
Oglethorpe, Rossville, Chickamauga, Trion, Varnell, Lookout Mountain,
Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, Resaca, Menlo, Center Post, Subligna, Fairview
and Villanow.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder...you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

LAT...LON 3499 8486 3450 8487 3442 8549 3498 8560
TIME...MOT...LOC 0532Z 257DEG 45KT 3473 8555

WIND...40MPH

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR CHATTOOGA...WHITFIELD... CATOOSA...WALKER...NORTHWESTERN GORDON...DADE...SOUTHWESTERN MURRAY AND NORTHEASTERN FLOYD COUNTIES UNTIL 115 AM EST
